page.title: 17Children's Favourite Games 4
page.content: An indoor game which I enjoy is called 'Subbuteo' which is table soccer. To play this game there are 22 small figures which represent two soccer teams,each of the figures has a small weight at the bottom to keep it upright.The players are flicked so that the ball can be put into the net to score a goal.Each team has three tries to hit the ball by flicking it, if they fail then the ball goes to the opposition for their turn.The other rules are the same as for real soccer even down to the awarding of 'Penalties' for a 'Foul' near the goal mouth. Each team is made of plastic and represents one of the 92 Football League clubs,each team can be bought separately for about Â£1.99.The game is played on a board which is about 130cm long and lasts as long as necessary.
